title: oc 5.0 unable to upload any file
body:
## expected behaviour

upload a file

## actual behaviour 
error message: **upload to large**
the files you are trying to upload exceed the maximum size for file uploads on this server.

## configuration
web server: apache/2.2.21
php version: 5.3.22
owncloud version: 5.0.0

## problem
the upload-button is showing a tooltip like:
![oc-max-b](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/243115/259282/a2af9926-8cb9-11e2-9e6d-b365b02072e0.png)

so the problem is the php-function `disk_free_space()` in https://github.com/owncloud/core/blob/master/lib/files/storage/local.php#l221
called by
[`oc_helper::maxuploadfilesize()`](https://github.com/owncloud/core/blob/master/lib/helper.php#l769)

if i remove the @ before `disk_free_space()` the error-log reports:
`disk_free_space(): value too large for defined data type at lib/files/storage/local.php#221`

with the @ disk_free_space() will return false, but this wonâ´t be handled. i know this is an php issue but a possible solution will be:

```php
	public function free_space($path) {
		$space=@disk_free_space($this->datadir.$path);
		if($space === false){
			return \oc\files\free_space_unknown;
		}
		return $space;
	}
```

regards,
david
